docs.lead_paragraph: A sudden, sharp increase in babies with “no foreheads and very strange heads” was baffling doctors in Brazil. That set off a search for answers that led to a little-known pathogen, the Zika virus.

headline.main: How a Medical Mystery in Brazil Led Doctors to Zika
headline.print_headline: Medical Mystery With a Global Reach

docs.abstract: Surge of microcephalic babies at Brazilian hospitals provided impetus for research that led to discovery of Zika virus sweeping country; questions remain over how virus was able to incubate in Brazil for nearly 70 years undetected and how best to respond.
docs.snippet: A sudden, sharp increase in babies with “no foreheads and very strange heads” was baffling doctors in Brazil. That set off a search for answers that led to a little-known pathogen, the Zika virus.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. reported from New York; Simon Romero from Recife, Brazil; and Sabrina Tavernise from Washington.
byline.original: By DONALD G. McNEIL Jr., SIMON ROMERO and SABRINA TAVERNISE

docs.lead_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention urged pregnant women whose male partners have spent time in a Zika-affected country to abstain from sex or use condoms during their pregnancy.

headline.main: C.D.C. Issues Zika Advisory for Pregnant Women and Sex Partners
headline.print_headline: Zika Transmission via Sex Prompts C.D.C. Advisory

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention advise pregnant women to use condoms or abstain from sex with male partners who have traveled through countries affected by Zika virus; warning comes after Dallas health officials confirm first American case of sexual transmission of Zika virus, which is potentially linked to birth defects.
docs.snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention urged pregnant women whose male partners have spent time in a Zika-affected country to abstain from sex or use condoms during their pregnancy.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The state will offer tests to all pregnant women who have been to a country affected by the Zika epidemic, regardless of whether they show symptoms, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said.

headline.main: New York State to Offer Free Zika Testing to Pregnant Travelers
headline.print_headline: State to Offer Free Zika Testing to Pregnant Travelers Amid Outbreak

docs.abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces New York State will provide free testing to any pregnant women who have traveled to country affected by Zika virus outbreak, even if they do not have symptoms.
docs.snippet: The state will offer tests to all pregnant women who have been to a country affected by the Zika epidemic, regardless of whether they show symptoms, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two cases of Zika being transmitted through blood transfusions were reported in Brazil on Thursday, adding to concerns over the virus that has been linked to severe birth defects and is typically spread through mosquito bites.

headline.main: Brazil Zika Cases Raise Concern of Virus Transmission Beyond Mosquitoes
headline.print_headline: Brazil Zika Cases Raise Concern of Virus Transmission Beyond Mosquitoes

docs.snippet: Two cases of Zika being transmitted through blood transfusions were reported in Brazil on Thursday, adding to concerns over the virus that has been linked to severe birth defects and is typically spread through mosquito bites.

docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil is not sharing enough samples and disease data to let researchers determine whether the Zika virus is, as feared, linked to the increased number of babies born with abnormally small heads in the South American country, U.N. and U.S. health officials say.

headline.main: Health Officials Want More Zika Samples, Data From Brazil
headline.print_headline: Health Officials Want More Zika Samples, Data From Brazil

docs.snippet: Brazil is not sharing enough samples and disease data to let researchers determine whether the Zika virus is, as feared, linked to the increased number of babies born with abnormally small heads in the South American country, U.N. and U.S. health...

docs.lead_paragraph: U.N. and U.S. health officials tell The Associated Press that Brazil has yet to share enough samples and disease data needed to answer the most worrying question about the Zika outbreak: whether the virus is actually responsible for the increase in the number of babies born with abnormally small heads in Brazil.

headline.main: APNewsbreak: Few Zika Samples Being Shared by Brazil
headline.print_headline: APNewsbreak: Few Zika Samples Being Shared by Brazil

docs.lead_paragraph: It's ethical to test a provocative new fertility technique that would prevent mothers from passing on rare but devastating diseases by creating embryos from the DNA of three people — dad, mom and an egg donor — advisers to the government said Wednesday.

headline.main: Report: It's Ethical to Test Embryos From DNA of 3 People
headline.print_headline: Report: It's Ethical to Test Embryos From DNA of 3 People

docs.snippet: It's ethical to test a provocative new fertility technique that would prevent mothers from passing on rare but devastating diseases by creating embryos from the DNA of three people — dad, mom and an egg donor — advisers to the government...

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials in Dallas reported that a patient with Zika virus was infected after having sex with an ill individual who had returned from a country where Zika was circulating.

headline.main: Zika Infection Transmitted by Sex Reported in Texas
headline.print_headline: Dallas Reports a Case of Zika Spread by Sex

docs.abstract: Dallas County Health and Human Services Dept reports patient was infected with Zika virus after having sex with someone who had returned from Venezuela, where virus is circulating; news will likely complicate efforts to contain virus and has prompted Centers for Disease Control to amend its advice to those traveling to Zika-affected regions.
docs.snippet: Officials in Dallas reported that a patient with Zika virus was infected after having sex with an ill individual who had returned from a country where Zika was circulating.

docs.lead_paragraph: Proton pump inhibitor medications are among the most frequently prescribed in the country, but were not intended for long-term use.

headline.main: Study Finds Growing Reason to Be Wary of Some Reflux Drugs

docs.abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age column; studies show frequent use of heartburn drugs known as proton pump inhibitors can lead to range of health problems including bone fractures, low magnesium levels, infections and chronic kidney disease.
docs.snippet: Proton pump inhibitor medications are among the most frequently prescribed in the country, but were not intended for long-term use.

docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization declared a global emergency over the explosive spread of the Zika virus, which has been linked to birth defects in the Americas, calling it an "extraordinary event" that poses a public health threat to other parts of the world.

headline.main: WHO Declares Global Emergency Over Zika Virus Spread
headline.print_headline: WHO Declares Global Emergency Over Zika Virus Spread
